image.altText: two women sitting at a table looking through documents

props.synopsis: It's been a long and exhausting journey, and even a legally-binding order made by a civil tribunal may not have brought their fight to an end.

title.children: 'We just want to have long service leave': Workers' long fight for entitlements

image.altText: A man faces the camera in a mughsot, with long dark braids and wearing a blue t-shirt.

props.synopsis: Police were searching for Thor Kristiansen for a week after receiving multiple reports including property damage and driving offences.

title.children: Thor Kristiansen arrested after manhunt through Canberra's streets

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson smiling enters Federal Court in Sydney before Bruce Lehrmann defamation judgment, media around

props.synopsis: Federal Court Justice Michael Lee expresses frustration over further delays in the costs battle between journalist Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over the Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, telling the court he wants an end to his involvement in it.

title.children: 'I want to bring this to an end': Frustration in court over costs dispute between Ten and Wilkinson

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The man was found guilty last year of unauthorised camping on unleased national land after sleeping in his car in the National Rock Garden carpark near Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin.

title.children: Judge finds homeless man who slept in his car on national land was parking there not camping

image.altText: Three large metal structures in a paddock with cows.

props.synopsis: The federal government has green-lit a southern NSW project that will form a key part of its plan to connect more renewable energy to the grid.

title.children: Controversial $4.8b Snowy 2.0 transmission project gets federal approval

image.altText: Generic photo of people swimming in the ocean at an Adelaide beach on a hot day.

props.synopsis: Christmas Day is looking dry and sunny for most of the country, with a distinctive lack of rain-producing low-pressure systems, troughs or cold fronts appearing on the charts.

title.children: Canberra set for warm and sunny Christmas Day, with heatwave to come later

image.altText: An artist's impression showing Europa Clipper nearing Jupiter.

props.synopsis: A team at the Canberra Deep Space Communication Complex is tasked with making "first contact" with NASA's largest and most expensive spacecraft, the Europa Clipper, on its journey to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon.

title.children: Deep space experts tracking NASA mission to Jupiter's fourth-largest moon

image.altText: a man smiles holding a handful of oysters up and water in the background

props.synopsis: The countdown to Christmas is on and oyster farmers on the NSW south coast are embracing what is shaping up to be the best season in nearly a decade.

title.children: Pearler of a Christmas ahead for these oyster farmers

image.altText: People line up to board a royal australian air force plane in vanuatu

props.synopsis: The death toll in Vanuatu following two earthquakes has been revised to nine but is expected to rise as there are fears for people still trapped under buildings.

title.children: 148 Australians return home on RAAF flights as aid teams arrive in Vanuatu

image.altText: Clare sits in front of a row of windows at parliament house.

props.synopsis: The government has found a legislative workaround to restrict how many international students can study in Australia, after laws to impose caps were rejected by the Coalition and Greens.

title.children: International student numbers to be limited using legal workaround

image.altText: two children stand at the edge of a flooded road

props.synopsis: An emergency alert was issued earlier this morning for Jandowae Creek in the Western Downs, with residents in low-lying areas urged to leave.

title.children: Heavy rains to move north after storms lash south-east Queensland

image.altText: fire through the bushland overhead shot

props.synopsis: Properties have come under threat near Victoria's Grampians National Park after a bushfire ripped through more than 5,000 hectares of land in just 24 hours.

title.children: Fire in Victoria's Grampians grows 10 times bigger in a day

image.altText: Sally Catherall standing in her front yard.

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to those who took alternative and complementary medicines after a cancer diagnosis and asks how they navigated their beliefs.

title.children: Cancer patient told she wasn't 'positive enough' when turmeric didn't work

image.altText: Woman smiling at camera

props.synopsis: Daniel Billings, who is accused of murdering childcare worker and mother Molly Ticehurst, has been charged with four additional offences.

title.children: Fresh charges against Molly Ticehurst's accused killer, including rape

image.altText: A man in a green long-coat stands next to a woman in a long grey coat alongside a wall with pictures of people on it

props.synopsis: Australia will reopen its embassy in Ukraine's war-torn capital Kyiv, with Penny Wong making the announcement on the first visit to Kyiv by an Australian foreign minister since Russia's full-scale invasion in 2022.

title.children: Australia to reopen embassy in Ukraine almost three years after closure

props.synopsis: A small farming town in regional WA is bucking the trend of shrinking populations. Tambellup has seen an 8 per cent increase in the past 12 months as cheap house prices lure more people to the arid countryside.

title.children: Cheap inland houses are prompting a 'dry barren landscape change'

image.altText: A plume of black smoke rises over the region of northern gaza

props.synopsis: Sources have said an agreement could be signed in coming days on a ceasefire and a release of hostages held in Gaza in return for Palestinian prisoners held by Israel.

title.children: At least 30 killed in Israeli air strikes on northern Gaza, medics say

image.altText: Marsden in the bush surrounding Candelbark school.

props.synopsis: Acclaimed children's author John Marsden raised generations of children through his bestselling books and the schools he founded.

title.children: John Marsden had no biological children but raised generations of kids

image.altText: Child holding hand

props.synopsis: Children with disability are frequently misunderstood by responders, slip through the cracks of multiple service providers and can at times be used as weapons, parents and advocates say.

title.children: NDIS plans of children with disability weaponised by abusive parents

image.altText: A young man in a grey button-up shirt and black pants sits in a wheelchair with his hands ion the wheels.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old Sydney man says he was told his wheelchair posed a risk to patrons and was made to leave the dancefloor on a night out at the 3 Wise Monkeys pub with his mates.

title.children: Man kicked off Sydney pub's dancefloor because of wheelchair

image.altText: daughter holding photo

props.synopsis: Sonja Kurtzer was a "trailblazing feminist" who inevitably lost her identity in an attempt to seek "spiritual healing". Now, her daughter Ellen Bertani is on a quest for justice.

title.children: Ellen's mum sought 'spiritual healing', then stopped counselling and medication

image.altText: A close-up of Jim Chalmers's face.

props.synopsis: The government's mid-year budget update is bereft of even the slightest whiff of pre-election razzamatazz — which makes it rather strange by the standards of budget politics.

title.children: Chalmers wants you to immediately forget this budget update ever happened

image.altText: Cruz Hewitt looks back over his shoulder

props.synopsis: Lleyton Hewitt's 16-year-old son Cruz Hewitt has received a wildcard for the Australian Open qualifiers, alongside Bernard Tomic and former women's world number one Simona Halep.

title.children: Cruz Hewitt, son of Lleyton, handed wildcard for Australian Open qualifying

image.altText: A silver four-wheel-drive vehicle with its front end squashed under a collapsed building roof with debris scattered around

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's tourism businesses say visitors will play a major role in its post-earthquake recovery, when the country is ready for them.

title.children: Vanuatu's tourism operators assess damage after earthquake

image.altText: Woman vlogging at home with Christmas tree behind.

props.synopsis: A relatively new type of advertising is seeing "explosive growth" due to converging trends in consumer behaviour, with industry experts saying this Christmas will be the biggest ever for affiliate marketers.

title.children: Hidden commissions behind this year's Christmas gift guide boom

image.altText: Pina colada

props.synopsis: A toxicology report into the suspected alcohol poisonings at Fiji's Warwick Resort that left four Australians critically ill has found no traces of methanol.

title.children: 'No methanol' found in Fiji alcohol poisoning that hospitalised Australians

image.altText: Red Bull's Sergio Perez looks dejected after qualifying in ninth place, frowning and sweating

props.synopsis: While teammate Max Verstappen claimed the drivers' championship, Sergio Perez struggled in the midfield for most of 2024 and placed eighth.

title.children: Red Bull sack Perez, young Kiwi rumoured to partner F1's world champion

image.altText: Optus signs outside a shop in Brisbane on May 15 2012.

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog alleges that the telco giant engaged in unconscionable conduct in its Mount Isa store by creating fraudulent contracts for 42 vulnerable customers and racking up $150,000 of debt.

title.children: ACCC accuses Optus store of pushing customers into $150k debts

image.altText: Pat Cummins stands with his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Australia's Test captain Pat Cummins has rejected claims from former coach Darren Lehmann that chief selector George Bailey is too close to players.

title.children: Pat Cummins defends Test selectors after Darren Lehmann's criticism

image.altText: Green crops border a dirt road. The photo is taken from inside a 4WD

props.synopsis: The Shire of Esperance is investigating imposing its own penalties amid reports of widespread illegal cropping and land clearing in the region.

title.children: Authorities 'missing in action' over illegal WA cropping

image.altText: Mary Fowler challenges for the ball

props.synopsis: The Matildas duo of Mary Fowler and Alanna Kennedy have had a difficult night as Barcelona outplayed Manchester City in the Women's Champions League.

title.children: Matildas have mixed night in Champions League

image.altText: Henderson from the air

props.synopsis: The burgeoning shipyard at Henderson, south of Perth, is preparing for its three-decade mission, which will culminate in the arrival of Australia's own nuclear-powered submarines.

title.children: Most people don't visit here, but AUKUS might make it Perth's most important place

image.altText: Twenty small ziplock backs containing different shaped and coloured pills and powders.

props.synopsis: NSW will begin a pill testing trial at music festivals from early 2025 in what it says will help combat the risks and harms associated with using illicit drugs.

title.children: NSW to begin pill testing trial at music festivals from early 2025

image.altText: A military helicopter flies over a ferry during a rescue operation.

props.synopsis: At least 13 people are killed as an Indian naval boat collides with a passenger ferry with more than 100 passengers, which then capsizes off the coast of financial capital Mumbai on Wednesday, officials say.

title.children: Thirteen dead after naval vessel hits passenger boat off Mumbai

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The delay means what should have been an eight-day stay on the International Space Station for Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore will now be at least nine months.

title.children: Return of NASA astronauts from ISS further delayed until late March
